main_text:
Empirical Work on the Public-Goods Problem
5. Empirical Work on the Public-Goods Problem

There has been an explosion of experimental work relevant to the
public goods problem since the rise of experimental economics in the
second half of the twentieth century. An important strand in this
literature describes results from so-called “public goods
games” (for a survey, see Ledyard 1995).
section_title: 5. Empirical Work on the Public-Goods Problem
